revision.comment: Reverted 2 edits by [[Special:Contributions/89.211.147.191|89.211.147.191]] ([[User talk:89.211.147.191|talk]]) to last revision by Hasanchoudhury97 ([[WP:TW|TW]])
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Mohamed Elneny | image = Rus-Egy (4).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Elneny with [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]. | fullname = Mohamed Naser Elsayed Elneny<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=10 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|7|11|df=y}}<ref name="Premier League">{{cite web |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/mohamed-elneny |title=Premier League Player Profile Mohamed Elneny |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2016 |publisher=Barclays Premier League |access-date=4 February 2016}}</ref> | birth_place = [[El Mahalla El Kubra]], Egypt | height = 1.80 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/5239/Mohamed-Elneny/overview |title=Mohamed Elneny: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=1 January 2019}}</ref> | position = [[Midfielder#Defensive midfielder|Defensive midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | clubnumber = 4 | youthyears1 = 1997–2008 | youthclubs1 = [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]] | youthyears2 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs2 = [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] | years1 = 2010–2013 | clubs1 = [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] | caps1 = 35 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2013 | clubs2 = → [[FC Basel|Basel]] (loan) | caps2 = 15 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2013–2016 | clubs3 = [[FC Basel|Basel]] | caps3 = 76 | goals3 = 5 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] | caps4 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->42<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | goals4 = <!--LEAGUE ONLY-->0<!--LEAGUE ONLY--> | nationalyears1 = 2009–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[Egypt national under-20 football team|Egypt U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 7 | nationalgoals1 = 2 | nationalyears2 = 2010–2015 | nationalteam2 = [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egypt U23]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 1 | nationalyears3 = 2011– | nationalteam3 = [[Egypt national football team|Egypt]] | nationalcaps3 = 67 | nationalgoals3 = 6 | pcupdate = 22:23, 9 February 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = 20:29, 8 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Mohamed Naser Elsayed Elneny''' ({{Lang-arz|محمد ناصر السيد الننى}} {{transl|arz|ALA|maḥamad nāṣṣer e-sayyed}} {{transl|arz|el nenny}}, {{IPA-arz|mæˈħæm.mæd ˈnɑːseɾ esˈsæj.jed enˈnen.ni|pron}}; born 11 July 1992)<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.tahrirnews.com/posts/360941/%D9%82%D8%B5%D8%A9+%D8%B5%D8%B9%D9%88%D8%AF+%C2%AB%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%86%D9%86%D9%8A%C2%BB..+%D9%85%D9%86+%D8%B4%D9%88%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%B9+%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%85%D8%AD%D9%84%D8%A9+%D8%A5%D9%84%D9%89+%D8%B9%D8%A7%D8%B5%D9%85%D8%A9+%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B6%D8%A8%D8%A7%D8%A8 |title=قصة صعود "النني".. من شوارع المحلة إلى عاصمة الضباب للمزيد |last=Hamdallah |first=Abu Bakr |date=30 December 2016 |website= |publisher=Tahrir News|access-date=}}</ref> simply known as '''Mohamed Elneny''',<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/ElNennyM |title=El-Neny's official facebook page}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mohamed-elneny |title=Mohamed Elneny |last= |first= |date= |website=Arsenal |publisher=|access-date=}}</ref> is an Egyptian professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for {{English football updater|Arsenal}} club [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] and the [[Egypt national football team|Egypt national team]].
He began his senior career at [[El Mokawloon SC|El Mokawloon]] and moved to [[FC Basel|Basel]] in January 2013. He won eight honours at Basel, including the [[Swiss Super League]] in each of his four seasons. In January 2016, he was transferred to Arsenal.
Elneny competed at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]] for the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|Egyptian Under-23 team]].
==Club career== ===El Mokawloon=== Elneny played his youth football with [[Al Ahly SC|Al Ahly]]. In 2008, he transferred to [[El Mokawloon SC]] during the [[2007–08 Egyptian Premier League|2010–2011 season]]. Elneny advanced and became a regular in the starting team. Following the [[Port Said Stadium disaster]], early February 2012, the Egyptian Premier League was stopped and all subsequent matches of the [[2011–12 Egyptian Premier League]] were postponed. On 10 March 2012, the [[Egyptian Football Association]] announced their decision to cancel the remainder of the season.<ref name=BBC>{{cite news |title=Egypt's Premier League cancelled |work=BBC Sport |publisher=British Broadcasting Corporation |date=10 March 2012 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17324997 |accessdate=11 March 2012}}</ref>
===Basel=== [[File:Mohamed Elneny.jpg|thumb|left|Elneny in 2013]]
[[FC Basel]] had been watching Elneny for some time and invited him to their training camp in [[Estepona]] from 14 to 24 January 2013. Elneny played his unofficial debut on 18 January 2013 during the friendly match against [[FC Steaua București|Steaua București]], a 1–1 draw. Elneny was able to impress Basel's trainer [[Murat Yakin]] during the training camp and on 29 January 2013, it was announced that he had signed a loan contract with Basel up until the end of June 2013.<ref name="fcb 1">{{cite web |last=FC Basel 1893 |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/29486/26/7/7 |title=Der Ägypter Mohamed Elneny wechselt leihweise zum FCB |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=29 January 2012 |language=de | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20140107195057/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/29486/26/7/7 | archive-date = 7 January 2014 | dead-url = yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="ahram1">{{cite web |last=Mosselhi |first=Mohamad |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/53/63624/Sports/Talents-Abroad/Egypt-midfielder-ElNenny-joins-Swiss-side-Basel-on.aspx |title=Arab Contractors midfielder Mohamed El-Nenny signs a six-month loan deal with Swiss side Basel |format= |work= |publisher=ahram.org.eg |accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref><ref name=" kingfut.com 1">{{cite web |last=King Fut |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.kingfut.com/2013/01/29/official-el-nenny-seals-loan-to-fc-basel/ |title=OFFICIAL: FC Basel sign Mohamed El-Nenny on loan |format= |work= |publisher=kingfut.com |accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref> Elneny played his official debut for Basel in the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|2012–13 Swiss Super League season]] on 10 February 2013 in the 3–0 home win against [[FC Sion|Sion]] as he was substituted in at half time.
At the end of the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|Swiss Super League season 2012–13]] Elneny won the Championship title<ref name="eufa 2013-06-10">{{cite web |last=Schifferle |first=Michael |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=sui/news/newsid=1959420.html |title=Season review: Switzerland |work= |publisher=Eufa |accessdate=10 June 2013}}</ref> and was [[2012–13 Swiss Cup|Swiss Cup runner up]] with Basel.<ref name="sfv2013-05-20">{{cite web |last=SFV |first= |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.football.ch/de/SFV/Schweizer-Cup/Schweizer-Cup-Maenner/Statistik-und-Resultate-Schweizer-Cup/Telegramm-Schweizer-Cup.aspx/tg-2132469/ |title=Telegramm Schweizer Cup Final |format= |work= |publisher=Schweizerischer Fussballverband |accessdate=20 May 2013 |language=de}}</ref> In the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League]] Basel advanced as far as the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Semi-finals|semi-finals]], there being matched against the reigning [[UEFA Champions League]] holders [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], but they were knocked out, losing both home and away ties, beaten 2–5 on aggregate.<ref name="eufa 2013-05-03">{{cite web |last=Haylett |first=Trevor |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1945605.html#basel+take+heart |title=Basel take heart after Chelsea defeat |format= |work= |publisher=Eufa |accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref>
During May 2013 Basel announced that they had taken up the option of signing the Egyptian midfielder on a permanent basis. He signed a four-year contract up-until 30 June 2017.<ref name="fcb 2013-05-03">{{cite web |last=Elassal |first=Mahmoud |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2013 |url=http://english.ahram.org.eg/NewsContent/6/53/70641/Sports/Talents-Abroad/Basel-take-up-option-to-buy-Egypts-ElNeny.aspx |title=Basel take up option to buy Egypt's Elneny |format= |work= |publisher=ahramonline |accessdate=3 May 2013}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Basel, the last goal of the match, in the 4–2 home win at the [[St. Jakob-Park]] against [[FC Zurich|Zurich]] on 16 April 2014.<ref name="fcb-2014-04-16">{{cite web |last=Marti |first=Caspar |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2014 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/32106/26/7/7 |title=Der FCB festigt seine Leaderposition mit einem 4:2 gegen den FCZ |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=16 April 2014 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20140426232551/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/32106/26/7/7 | archive-date = 26 April 2014 | dead-url = yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> At the end of the [[2013–14 Swiss Super League|2013–14 Super League season]] Elneny won the league championship with Basel.<ref name="fcb 2014-05-18">{{cite web |last=Grossenbacher |first=Sacha |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2014 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/Saison/Saisonspiel?m=2816 |title=Fotos vom Spiel gegen Lausanne sowie den anschliessenden Feierlichkeiten |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=18 May 2014 |language=de}}</ref> They also reached the final of the [[2013–14 Swiss Cup]], but were beaten 2–0 by [[FC Zürich|Zürich]] after extra time. During the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|2013–14 Champions League season]] Basel reached the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and finished the group in third position. Thus they qualified for [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League knockout phase|Europa League knockout phase]] and here they advanced as far as the quarter-finals. In their [[2013–14 FC Basel season|season 2013–14]] Basel played a total of 68 matches (36 Swiss League fixtures, 6 Swiss Cup, 6 Champions League and 10 Europa League and 10 test matches). Elneny totaled 55 appearances, 32 League, 4 Cup, 6 Champions League and 6 Europa League as well 7 in the test games.<ref name="Rotblau Jahrbuch">{{Cite book |last1=Zindel |first1=Josef |title=Rotblau: Jahrbuch Saison 2014/2015 |place= |publisher=FC Basel Marketing AG |year=2014 |url= |ISBN=978-3-7245-2027-6}}</ref> He scored just that one goal in the league.
The season 2014–15 was a very successful one for Elneny and FC Basel. The championship was won for the sixth time in a row [[2014–15 Swiss Super League|that season]]<ref name="fcb 2015-05-29">{{cite web |last=Marti |first=Caspar |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2015 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2015/05/29/Der-Meisterfreitag-im-bunten-Zeitraffer |title=Der Meisterfreitag im bunten Zeitraffer |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=29 May 2015}} {{de icon}}</ref> and in the [[2014–15 Swiss Cup]] they reached the final. But for the third season in a row, they finished as runners-up, losing 0–3 to [[FC Sion]] in the final. Basel entered the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and reached the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout phase]] as on 9 December 2014 they managed a 1–1 draw at [[Anfield]] against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29363537 |title=Liverpool 1 Basel 1 |date=10 December 2014 |work=BBC Sport |accessdate=10 December 2014}}</ref> But then Basel then lost to Porto in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|Round of 16]]. Basel played a total of 65 matches (36 Swiss League fixtures, 6 Swiss Cup, 8 Champions League and 15 test matches). Under manager [[Paulo Sousa]] Elneny totaled 51 appearances, 29 in the Super League, 6 in the Cup and 7 in the Champions League, as well 9 in test games. He scored 5 goals in these matches.<ref name="Rotblau Jahrbuch Nr.02">{{Cite book |last1=Zindel |first1=Josef |title=Rotblau: Jahrbuch Saison 2015/2016 |place= |publisher=FC Basel Marketing AG |year=2015 |url= |ISBN=978-3-7245-2050-4}}</ref>
Despite the fact that Elneny left the club during the winter break, under their new trainer [[Urs Fischer (footballer)|Urs Fischer]] Basel won the [[Swiss Super League]] championship at the end of the [[2015–16 Swiss Super League|2015–16 Super League season]]. For Elneny it was the fourth title, for the club it was the seventh in a row and their 19th championship title in total.<ref name="fcb 2016-04-30">{{cite web |first=Casper |last=Marti |authorlink= |coauthors= |year=2016 |url=http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2016/04/30/FCB-Sion |title=Es ist vollbracht ! Der FCB ist zum 19. Mal Meister |format= |work= |publisher=FC Basel 1893 |accessdate=30 April 2016}}</ref>
===Arsenal=== [[File:Arsenal Vs Burnley (24108353364).jpg|thumb|Elneny on his Arsenal debut against Burnley in January 2016]] On 13 January 2016, after a 3–3 draw against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], Arsenal manager [[Arsène Wenger]] confirmed the signing of Elneny from FC Basel.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny: Arsenal confirm signing from Basel |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/35308910 |accessdate=14 January 2016 |work=BBC Sport |date=14 January 2016}}</ref> The following day, the transfer was officially confirmed by the club for an undisclosed fee reported to be somewhere between £5 million and £7.4 million.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny joins Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160114/mohamed-elneny-joins-arsenal |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |title=Confirmed: Arsenal finally announce signing of midfielder Mohamed Elneny |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/634600/Confirmed-Arsenal-finally-announce-signing-of-midfielder-Mohamed-Elneny |publisher=[[Daily Express]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref> He was assigned the number 35 shirt for Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mohamed Elneny: Player Profile Arsenal |url=http://www.arsenal.com/first-team/players/mohamed-elneny |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=14 January 2016 |accessdate=14 January 2016}}</ref> He made his debut for the club in a 2–1 win against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in the fourth round of the [[FA Cup]], on 30 January.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Flanagan |first1=Chris |title=Why Elneny impressed on debut: 5 things from Arsenal 2–1 Burnley |url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/why-elneny-impressed-debut-5-things-arsenal-2-1-burnley#:YDpBT902moZmcA |website=FourFourTwo |accessdate=30 January 2016 |date=30 January 2016}}</ref> Elneny scored his first Arsenal goal in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] Round of 16 second leg defeat against [[FC Barcelona]], and was later awarded Arsenal's Player of the Month award for March. He also starred in April combining well with [[Aaron Ramsey]], winning the Arsenal's Player of the Month award for a second month. Elneny's only goal won him the goal of the season award for Arsenal.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Elneny tops Goal of the Season poll |url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/20160523/elneny-tops-goal-of-the-season-poll |publisher=[[Arsenal F.C.]] |date=22 May 2016 |accessdate=25 May 2016}}</ref> In the 2017/18 season, on 7 December 2017, Elneny scored his first goal at the Emirates Stadium (his second for Arsenal overall) in the [[2017-18 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] Group Stage against [[FC BATE Borisov]] in a match which ended 6–0 to the home side.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goal.com/en-ke/news/first-emirates-stadium-goal-means-a-lot-to-arsenals-mohamed/1njr8qq1vu3pk1od4w8ast5hjg |title=Arsenal's Mohamed Elneny pleased with first goal in the Emirates Stadium - Goal.com |publisher=}}</ref> On 15 February, Elneny again produced a commendable display in the first leg of Arsenal's round of 32 [[UEFA Europa League|Europa league]] tie against [[Östersunds FK]]. Elneny was subsequently rewarded man of the match for his effort in a 3–0 away victory.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43050414 |title=Ostersunds FK 0–3 Arsenal |date=15 February 2018 |work=BBC Sport|access-date=18 February 2018 |language=en-GB}}</ref>
On 26 March 2018, Elneny renewed his contract with Arsenal.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.arsenal.com/news/mo-elneny-signs-contract-extension |title=Mo Elneny signs contract extension |website=www.arsenal.com}}</ref>
On 8 April 2018, Elneny was sent off against [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. In a tight game defender [[Jack Stephens (footballer)|Jack Stephens]] tussled with [[Jack Wilshere]] and retaliation from Stephens resulted in referee [[Andre Marriner]] giving him a straight red. Wilshere escaped with just a yellow card but in the aftermath, Elneny received a red card after a shove on [[Cédric Soares]]. Arsenal held on to win 3–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/943121/Arsenal-Mohamed-Elneny-red-card-Southampton-video-watch |title=Did you see why Mohamed Elneny was sent off against Southampton? |publisher=Express |date=8 April 2018| access-date= 9 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43609100 |title=Arsenal 3–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 April 2018|access-date= 9 April 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Elneny helped the [[Egypt national under-23 football team|National Under-23 team]] qualify for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]],<ref name=BBC/> where he played in all four games as the team reached the last eight, and were knocked out by Japan.{{citation needed|date=February 2017}}
He was in the Egypt National First Team squad in the Africa Cup of Nations 2017 in Gabon, which came as Runners-up.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.cafonline.com/en-us/competitions/31theditionofafricancupofnationtotal,gabon2017/TeamDetails/Home?TeamsIDs=MuM2AcKem%2bfAOqvO60gI4lu%2fw9Txaot5Yw%2foRoU%2b0kxn1p6zmn0xCeAalsWOFqpM |title=2017 AFCON {{!}} Egypt|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=24 January 2018}}</ref> He also helped the team qualify to the 2018 FIFA World Cup tournament in Russia, this is the third time for the Egyptians to participate in the competition after the 1934 and 1990 editions.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/matches/round=276412/match=300367133/index.html#nosticky |title=Egypt vs. Congo Lineup |last= |first= |date=9 October 2017 |website=FIFA|access-date=24 January 2018}}</ref>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 9 February 2019}}<ref>{{cite web |title=Mohamed Elneny |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/mohamed-el-nenny/153493/ |website=Soccerway |accessdate=21 April 2018}}</ref> [[File:Arsenal 1 Chelsea 1 (4-1 on pens) (36421488485).jpg|thumb|upright|Elneny ''(right)'' playing for Arsenal against [[Arsenal F.C.–Chelsea F.C. rivalry|rival]] club [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in the [[2017 FA Community Shield]].]] {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan=2|Club !rowspan=2|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan=2|Cup |15||0||3||0||colspan="2"|—||8||0||26||0 |- |[[2013–14 FC Basel season|2013–14]] |Swiss Super League |32||1||4||0||colspan="2"|—||12||0||48||1 |- |[[2014–15 FC Basel season|2014–15]] |Swiss Super Community Shield|FA Community Shield]]}}||1||32||1 |- |[[2018–19 Arsenal F.C. season|2018–19]] |Premier League |4||0||1||0||1||0||5{{efn|Five appearances in [[2017–18 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]]}}||0||11||0 |- !colspan=2|Total !42!!0!!8!!0!!9!!0!!24!!2!!83!!2 |- !colspan=3|Career total !168!!7!!21!!2!!9!!0!!60!!4!!260!!13 |}

==Honours== '''Basel'''<ref name="fcb 1"/><ref name="eufa 2013-06-10"/><ref name="fcb 2013-05-03"/> *[[Swiss Super League]]: [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|2012–13]], [[2013–14 Swiss Super League|2013–14]], [[2014–15 Swiss Super League|2014–15]], [[2015–16 Swiss Super League|2015–16]]
'''Arsenal''' *[[FA Cup]]: [[2016–17 FA Cup|2016–17]] *[[FA Community Shield]]: [[2017 FA Community Shield|2017]]
